intro: Dipogonia setacea, commonly known as the hairy sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. This coastal plant is adapted to sandy or rocky shores, thriving in saline and well-drained environments. Its structure includes narrow, linear leaves and a compact growth habit that helps it withstand harsh maritime conditions. Dipogonia setacea plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
